uk.ac.cf.cs.scm5mjw.mda.devices
Interface CommunicationController

All Known Implementing Classes:
StandardCommController
public interface CommunicationController

A class implementing this interface is one that can be used to handle carrying out tasks relating to communication sessions, specifically:
1. Initiation
2. Completion
3. Abortion

Method Summary
 void abortCommunication(AbstractWirelessDevice dev1, AbstractWirelessDevice dev2)
          This method is called to abort a communication session between two devices.
 void attemptDiscovery(AbstractWirelessDevice dev1, AbstractWirelessDevice dev2)
          This method is called after the time required for the initiation phase has elapsed.
 void completeCommunication(AbstractWirelessDevice dev1, AbstractWirelessDevice dev2)
          This method is called after the time required for the transmission phase has elapsed (and hence the time required for the entire communication has also elapsed).
 void initiateCommunication(AbstractWirelessDevice dev1, AbstractWirelessDevice dev2)
          This method is called to initiate a communication session between two devices.
 

Method Detail

initiateCommunication

void initiateCommunication(AbstractWirelessDevice dev1,
                           AbstractWirelessDevice dev2)
This method is called to initiate a communication session between two devices.
This will result in the devices entering the 'initiation' phase (unconditionally).

attemptDiscovery

void attemptDiscovery(AbstractWirelessDevice dev1,
                      AbstractWirelessDevice dev2)
This method is called after the time required for the initiation phase has elapsed. At this point, the devices may enter the transmission phase if the discovery attempt succeeds.
Two examples of why a discovery may fail are:
- The devices have moved out of range when discovery is attempted
- We are modelling a blanket discovery failure rate in the system

completeCommunication

void completeCommunication(AbstractWirelessDevice dev1,
                           AbstractWirelessDevice dev2)
This method is called after the time required for the transmission phase has elapsed (and hence the time required for the entire communication has also elapsed).
This is also known as the completion of the communication.

abortCommunication

void abortCommunication(AbstractWirelessDevice dev1,
                        AbstractWirelessDevice dev2)
This method is called to abort a communication session between two devices.
